member.name: T:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions
member.summary: Platform-specific options which apply to Linux.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.UseEGL
member.summary: Enables native Linux EGL when set to true. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.UseGpu
member.summary: Determines whether to use GPU for rendering in your project. The default value is true.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.OverlayPopups
member.summary: Embeds popups to the window when set to true. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.UseDBusMenu
member.summary: Enables global menu support on Linux desktop environments where it's supported (e. g. XFCE and MATE with plugin, KDE, etc). The default value is false.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.UseDeferredRendering
member.summary: Deferred renderer would be used when set to true. Immediate renderer when set to false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Avalonia has two rendering modes: Immediate and Deferred rendering. Immediate re-renders the whole scene when some element is changed on the scene. Deferred re-renders only changed elements.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.EnableIme
member.summary: Determines whether to use IME. IME would be enabled by default if the current user input language is one of the following: Mandarin, Japanese, Vietnamese or Korean.
member.remarks: Input method editor is a component that enables users to generate characters not natively available on their input devices by using sequences of characters or mouse operations that are natively available on their input devices.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.EnableSessionManagement
member.summary: Determines whether to enable support for the X Session Management Protocol.
member.remarks: X Session Management Protocol is a standard implemented on most Linux systems that uses Xorg. This enables apps to control how they can control and/or cancel the pending shutdown requested by the user.

member.name: P:Avalonia.X11PlatformOptions.EnableMultiTouch
member.summary: Enables multitouch support. The default value is true.
member.remarks: Multitouch allows a surface (a touchpad or touchscreen) to recognize the presence of more than one point of contact with the surface at the same time.
